Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mastoparan-X (MPX, peptide 12a; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: venom, the wasp,Vespa magnifica(Smith) orVespa xanthoptera

Literature Information.Literature: Active against L. lactis (MIC 2.5 uM) and E. coli (MIC 8 uM) (Henriksen JR et al., 2014). Also active against E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 7.5 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC2592 (MIC 3.7 uM), and C. albicans ATCC2002 (MIC 3.7 ug/ml) (Xu et al., 2006). It also stimulates phospholipase A2 activity and activates G proteins.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: HC50 349.4 uM; rat RBC: HC50 156.5 uM. Less hemo.lytic (Ye et al., 2023).Structure: The C-terminal 12 residues adopted helical conformation upon binding to membranes (Wakamatsu K et al., 1992).Discoveryy: Found in multiple species.Updated 7/2021; 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Nakajima T, Uzu S, Wakamatsu K, Saito K, Miyazawa T, Yasuhara T, Tsukamoto Y, Fujino M.1986
Literature Information.Title: Amphiphilic peptides in wasp venom.
